properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 25 at 3:45PM AKST until January 26 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Reduced visibilities to one
quarter mile or less. Northeast winds 40 mph gusting between 50
to 60 mph.

* WHERE...Thompson Pass.

* WHEN...From 3 AM to 9 AM AKST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce
visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below
zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10
minutes.
properties.instruction:
A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are
expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds
and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel,
have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay
with your vehicle.

For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit
511.alaska.gov.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 9 AM AKST SUNDAY THROUGH THOMPSON PASS
